final_answer:
The humor in this comic comes from the juxtaposition of two contrasting scenes labeled "YES," and "BUT". 

On the left panel, a person is exercising on a rowing machine and appears to be working hard, indicated by sweating and wearing a headband. The scene represents someone putting in effort to simulate rowing indoors.

In contrast, the right panel shows a person sitting relaxed in a motorboat on the ocean. This person is not exerting any physical effort, as the boat provides propulsion.

The satirical humor arises from the idea of exercising hard indoors on a machine that simulates rowing, versus casually operating a motorboat which moves with ease outdoors. It highlights the irony between exercising for fitness and experiencing actual movement in a more leisurely and effortless way.
